message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SOC, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

The paper deals with recommender systems, which are typically studied in the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR). However, the paper specifically focuses on trust-based recommender systems, which are a subset of recommender systems that utilize social connections between users. This makes the paper relevant to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The paper also mentions the use of similarity matrices and k-nearest neighbors, which are common techniques in the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) and the sub-category of Databases (cs.DB). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on a dataset crawled from Epinions, which is a website for consumer reviews, making it relevant to the sub-category of Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC).
